page.title: 13BUTLEIGH SCHOOL - 1845
page.content:
The village school was built in 1845 as a National School, and had 150 children between three and twelve years old, with two teachers and two pupil teachers. The classes were mixed but the playground was segregated. The curriculum was Maths, Reading and Writing, Needlework for the girls, Military drill for the boys, and Scripture. The Squire often visited the school, and when he entered, this conversation from H.M.S. Pinafore ensued:
{Squire: My gallant crew, good morning. {School: Sir, good morning. {Squire: Hope you are all quite well. {School: We're all quite well, hope you {are as well. As the Squire checked the register,the boys saluted.
